title: Electrical Properties Data Schema
description: Measurements of the electrical properties of rock provide fundamental input to calibrate and interpret resistivity log measurements for water saturation interpretation. These data are applied in fluid saturation models. This content schema includes formation resistivity factor (F or FRF) and resistivity index (I). Note that the electrical property categories of CoCw (multiple salinity, Qv) and CEC (wet chemistry cation exchange capacity) are not handled by this specific content schema.

SampleID.title: Sample ID
SampleID.description: OSDU Identifier for the Sample associated with this analysis

items.title: Frame of Reference Meta Data Item
items.description: A meta data item, which allows the association of named properties or property values to a Unit/Measurement/CRS/Azimuth/Time context.

kind.title: UOM Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, 'Unit' for FrameOfReferenceUOM.

name.title: UOM Unit Symbol
name.description: The unit symbol or name of the unit.

persistableReference.title: UOM Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying the Unit.

unitOfMeasureID.description: SRN to unit of measure reference.

propertyNames.title: UOM Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides Unit context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: CRS Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'CRS' for FrameOfReferenceCRS.

persistableReference.title: CRS Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying the CRS.

propertyNames.title: CRS Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides CRS context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: DateTime Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'DateTime', for FrameOfReferenceDateTime.

name.title: DateTime Name
name.description: The name of the DateTime format and reference.

persistableReference.title: DateTime Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying DateTime reference.

propertyNames.title: DateTime Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides DateTime context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: AzimuthReference Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'AzimuthReference', for FrameOfReferenceAzimuthReference.

name.title: AzimuthReference Name
name.description: The name of the CRS or the symbol/name of the unit.

persistableReference.title: AzimuthReference Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying AzimuthReference.

propertyNames.title: AzimuthReference Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides AzimuthReference context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

BrineConcentration.title: Brine Concentration
BrineConcentration.description: The salinity level of the brine used in the test, sometimes represented as CoCw or the Concentration of Conductive Water), affecting the rock's electrical resistivity properties.

FormationResistivityFactor.title: Formation Resistivity Factor
FormationResistivityFactor.description: The ratio of the resistivity of the rock fully saturated with brine to the resistivity of the brine itself, used in determining water saturation. Also called FRF.

AdjustedFormationResistivityFactor.title: Adjusted Formation Resistivity Factor
AdjustedFormationResistivityFactor.description: A modified value of the formation resistivity factor adjusted for specific experimental conditions or data corrections.

CementationExponent.title: Cementation Exponent
CementationExponent.description: A parameter in Archie’s law representing the rock’s pore structure and its influence on resistivity, affecting saturation calculations.

AdjustedCementationExponent.title: Adjusted Cementation Exponent
AdjustedCementationExponent.description: A modified value of the cementation exponent, accounting for specific experimental conditions or data corrections.

AverageSaturationExponent.title: Average Saturation Exponent
AverageSaturationExponent.description: A factor describing the relationship between water saturation and resistivity, crucial for interpreting reservoir fluid saturation.

AdjustedAverageSaturationExponent.title: Adjusted Average Saturation Exponent
AdjustedAverageSaturationExponent.description: A modified value of the saturation exponent, accounting for experimental conditions or measurement adjustments.

FormationFactorAtNetOverburdenPressure.title: Formation Factor At Net Overburden Pressure
FormationFactorAtNetOverburdenPressure.description: The formation resistivity factor (FRF) measured under the net confining pressure that simulates in-situ reservoir conditions.

AdjustedFormationFactorAtNetOverburdenPr.title: Adjusted Formation Factor At Net Overburden Pressure
AdjustedFormationFactorAtNetOverburdenPr.description: The formation factor adjusted for experimental conditions under net overburden pressure.

NumberOfElectrodes.title: Number Of Electrodes
NumberOfElectrodes.description: The number of electrodes used in the experimental setup to measure electrical properties in the sample.

QuantityOfOilInTheVolume.title: Quantity Of Oil In The Volume
QuantityOfOilInTheVolume.description: The volume fraction of oil present in the rock sample during the electrical property measurement.

InjectionFluidID.title: Injection Fluid Type ID
InjectionFluidID.description: The type of fluid injected into a sample to displace other fluids during the experiment.

DisplacedFluidTypeID.title: Displaced Fluid Type ID
DisplacedFluidTypeID.description: The type of fluid being displaced from the rock sample during saturation or desaturation measurements.

SaturationProcessMethodID.title: Saturation Process Method ID
SaturationProcessMethodID.description: The method used to saturate the rock sample with a particular fluid in the experiment.

DesaturationMethodID.title: Desaturation Method ID
DesaturationMethodID.description: The technique used to reduce the saturation of the rock sample, important for measuring electrical properties under varying saturations.

BrineResistivity.title: Brine Resistivity
BrineResistivity.description: The resistivity of the brine solution, which influences the resistivity index calculations.

Temperature.title: Temperature
Temperature.description: The temperature at which the electrical properties measurements are conducted, affecting fluid behavior and resistivity.

Frequency.title: Frequency
Frequency.description: The frequency of the electrical current used in the measurements, impacting the resistivity response of the rock.

FormationResistivity.title: Formation Resistivity
FormationResistivity.description: This could also be Formation Conductivity.

FormationDiaelectricPermittivity.title: Formation Diaelectric Permittivity
FormationDiaelectricPermittivity.description: A measure of how easily the formation's materials (rock, fluid, and any pore spaces) can polarize in response to an applied electric field.

PorosityAtNetConfiningStress.title: Porosity At Net Confining Stress
PorosityAtNetConfiningStress.description: The amount of pore space relative to the volume of a sample at net confining stress.

CapillaryPressureAnalysisID.title: Capillary Pressure Analysis ID
CapillaryPressureAnalysisID.description: Identifier of the specific capillary pressure analysis related to this electrical properties analysis, if provided.

WOGnCycleNotationID.title: Water Oil Gas Number ID
WOGnCycleNotationID.description: The WOGn notation description of the capillary pressure cycle.

StepNumber.title: Step Number
StepNumber.description: Internal step number which identifies the sequence of steps in this analysis.

IsPressureIncreasing.title: Is Pressure Increasing
IsPressureIncreasing.description: Identifies whether the pressure is increasing or decreasing during this test step.  A value of True indicates an increasing pressure cycle.  False indicates a decreasing pressure cycle.

WaterSaturationOverResistivityIndex.title: Water Saturation Over Resistivity Index
WaterSaturationOverResistivityIndex.description: The relationship between water saturation and resistivity index, used to interpret fluid saturations in the rock.

BrineSaturation.title: Brine Saturation
BrineSaturation.description: The fraction of pore space in the rock that is filled with brine, a key input for water saturation models.

ResistivityIndex.title: Resistivity Index
ResistivityIndex.description: The index of resistivity used to relate resistivity measurements to water saturation in the sample.

AdjustedResistivityIndex.title: Adjusted Resistivity Index
AdjustedResistivityIndex.description: The resistivity index value adjusted or corrected for specific conditions.

SaturationExponent.title: Saturation Exponent
SaturationExponent.description: A factor describing the relationship between water saturation and resistivity, crucial for interpreting reservoir fluid saturation.

AdjustedSaturationExponent.title: Adjusted Saturation Exponent
AdjustedSaturationExponent.description: A modified value of the saturation exponent, accounting for experimental conditions or measurement adjustments.

FormationResistivityFactor.title: Formation Resistivity Factor
FormationResistivityFactor.description: The ratio of the resistivity of the rock fully saturated with brine to the resistivity of the brine itself, used in determining water saturation. Also called FRF.

NetConfiningStress.title: Net Confining Stress
NetConfiningStress.description: The pressure exerted on a sample from its environment, minus the pore pressure within the sample

Porosity.title: Porosity
Porosity.description: The amount of pore space relative to the volume of a sample.

PorosityFractionOfOriginalAmbient.title: Porosity Fraction Of Original Ambient
PorosityFractionOfOriginalAmbient.description: The porosity of the sample at this test step as a fraction of the original porosity at ambient conditions.

PorosityFractionOfOriginalStandard.title: Porosity Fraction Of Original Standard
PorosityFractionOfOriginalStandard.description: The porosity of the sample at this test step as a fraction of the original porosity at standard conditions.

BrinePermeability.title: Brine Permeability
BrinePermeability.description: Quantifies the ability for brine to flow through a sample.

BrinePermeabilityFractionOfOriginal.title: Brine Permeability Fraction Of Original
BrinePermeabilityFractionOfOriginal.description: The permeability of the sample to brine at this test step as a fraction of the original permeability.

Remarks.title: Remarks
Remarks.description: Array object capturing remarks or additional information for this test step.  Remarks for the analysis as a whole should be captured in the associated SamplesAnalysis work product component.

items.title: AbstractRemark
items.description: A remark object, pairing a remark text with a source, e.g. an author, and a date, which is typically included in an array. The RemarkSequenceNumber acts as unique key in this case.

RemarkSequenceNumber.title: Remark Sequence Number
RemarkSequenceNumber.description: A unique identifier for each remark record. This identifier is used to uniquely identify a member in an array of remarks.

Remark.title: Remark
Remark.description: A descriptive comment for this remark.

RemarkSource.title: Remark Source
RemarkSource.description: The person, vendor, interpreter or other provider of information.

RemarkDate.title: Remark Date
RemarkDate.description: The date the remark was issued.
